detailedDescription: Guide price £700,000 - £725,000 This wonderful four bedroom, end of terrace home has been well maintained by its current owners and is a fantastic addition to the martket. Walking in from the quiet residential street you are welcomed into a large hallway, on the right is the reception which is very spacious and provides fantastic living space. On the left is the Dining room which is perfect for entertaining guests. The kitchen has fitted appliances and leads onto the lush green garden, perfect for children and those summer BBQ&rsquo;s. The garage is larger than average with ample storage space and potential to use as an office. On the first floor you will find four well proportioned bedrooms, on suite and a separate family bathroom. Love Lane is an ideal residential location benefiting from charming public green spaces, excellent local amenities, walking distance to Chigwell Underground Station and close by to West Hatch School.

title: 4 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
A superlative two double bedroom apartment on the first floor of a purpose built development, all sat in a great position minutes from Snaresbrook Station. Everything's in excellent decorative order, with bright and generous living spaces, this is a secure, serene home ready for new people to make their own.

The development sits in neatly kept communal gardens surrounded by trees, perfect for picnics in summer, and a beautiful calming setting year round. Your apartment also comes with the gold dust addition of a separate garage, so no more worries about parking near home. Plenty of extra storage space too.

If you lived here…

You'll step into your entrance hall, note the storage to your right and step into your bathroom to the left. Fully tiled in white and red, it has a modern white suite with shower over the tub, and plenty of natural light. The next door takes you into the semi open plan living space, with the eighty five square foot kitchen to the left and 270 square foot lounge to the right. Your kitchen has an abundance of creamy white units and light grey metro tiled backsplashes.

The lounge has blonde engineered flooring underfoot, and two windows filled with greenery. Your first bedroom of seventy five square feet is past the kitchen on the left, with engineered flooring underfoot. Back through the entrance hall you'll find your second bedroom, close to 150 square foot of relaxing space with another soothing view of mature trees.

It's just half a mile to Snaresbrook Station for the Central Line, from where you can be at Liverpool Street in twenty minutes or Stratford for shopping at Westfield in just eight. If you're driving you'll find it's handy for the North Circular. Within ten minutes you can be exploring Epping Forest, meeting new feathered friends at Eagle Pond or boating on Hollow Ponds.

What else?

- Your new local is The Duke in Wanstead, a gorgeous chilled-out pub that does a splendid Sunday roast and offers discounts for hospitality workers.
- There's a long lease to give you peace of mind from the start.
- Once you're in and settled, why not go for some restorative yoga or pilates at Wellness Yoga Conscious school? Just ten minutes walk away.

Sat just inside the North Circular, South Woodford blends metropolitan bustle with suburban tranquility and easy routes out of London. Flanked by the endlessly explorable open green spaces of Epping Forest, here you'll find an eclectic mix of contemporary developments, stout vintage properties and conversions.

As well a thriving community in its own right, centred around the social hub of George Lane, you also have both Wanstead and Walthamstow Villages within easy reach, for some of the finest wining and dining spots North East London has to offer.

South Woodford tube station sits in the heart of the area, situated in Zone 4 on the Central line, putting Liverpool Street just eighteen minutes away and the West End just nine minutes further.

detailedDescription:
Lawlor’s are pleased to offer to the market this substantial and imposing eleven bedroom detached period house that is situated on a rarely available very enviably sized plot.

The Green is a highly sought-after location on the Monkhams Estate being within the Monkhams Conservation Area. Ideally placed for local transport both road and tube. There are several well regarded state and independent schools within easy reach and a wide range of leisure activities including sports clubs and a golf course.

Internally the accommodation has an abundance of grandeur that extends to circa 4,000 sq. Ft and is arranged over three floors. The ground floor provides a grand entrance hall, lobby area, four reception rooms, kitchen, pantry, utility room, cellar, conservatory, shower room, two guest cloakrooms and a study. The first floor boasts seven bedrooms and two shower rooms. On the second floor there are a further four bedrooms, bathroom and eaves storage.

Externally, to the front of the house there is a carriage driveway providing off street parking for several cars. The landscaped mature rear garden of circa 150 ft is a standout feature of the house.

Agents Note – The property would lend itself to extensive remodelling and extension, if required, and subject to planning permission.

An early viewing is advised of this exceptional house.<br /><br />

Auctioneer Comments

This property is for sale under traditional auction terms and should you view, offer or bid on the property, your information will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold Limited.

With this auction method, an immediate exchange of contracts takes place with completion of the purchase required to take place within 28 days from the date of exchange of contracts. On exchange of contracts, the buyer is required to make payment of a 10% deposit, sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee of 4.2% of the final agreed sale price including VAT. This is subject to a minimum payment of £6,000 inc VAT and is paid in addition to the agreed purchase price. The Reservation Fee will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability. The Reservation Fee is paid in addition to the final negotiated selling price. The Reservation Fee will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability.

This property is marketed with a Buyers Information Pack which is a collection of documents in relation to the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know about the property and a prudent buyer is expected to view the property and complete their own due diligence before bidding. A sample copy of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are also contained with this pack. The winning buyer will also make payment of £300 inc VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack, where it has been provided by iamsold

Bidders will be required to register and go through an identification verification process with iamsold Limited and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded.

Please note this property is subject to an undisclosed reserve price which is generally no more than 10% in excess of the starting bid, both the starting bid and reserve price can be subject to change.

Referral Arrangements

The Partner Agent and Auctioneer may recommend the services of third parties to you. Whilst these services are recommended as it is believed they will benefit you; you are under no obligation to use any of these services and you should always consider your options before services are accepted. Where services are accepted, please be aware that the Auction Coordinator or Partner Agent may receive payment for the recommendation. Where this is the case, the Partner Agent and Auctioneer will inform you of any referral arrangements and any payment they will receive, prior to any services being taken by you.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Open House Saturday 17th July 2Pm-5Pm
The Good Estate Agent Is Proud To Offer To The Market This Stunning Four Bedroom End Of Terrace Family Home.

This home has the wow factor! Having been extended and refurbished throughout by the current owners and with unique bespoke features throughout this is the property that you will call home for years to come.
The ground floor has been extended by six meters and offers an open plan kitchen diner that is packed with features including underfloor heating, Bosch integrated oven, microwave and warming drawer, Caple frame less multi zone induction hob and a 5 metre wide folding glass wall which opens out onto a garden which is great for entertaining. There is also a separate family room to the front of the house as well as a cloakroom and utility room.
To the first floor are three bedrooms, a three piece family bathroom including underfloor heating and a built in TV/mirror.
The second floor is a full height loft conversion that is home to master suite and en suite wet room. The juliet balcony looks out over the amazing back garden. The wet room has underfloor heating.
The rear garden is the perfect space for entertaining having been landscaped into two parts. At the end of the garden is the entertaining space that is home to an eight seater hot tub, BBQ and bar area, as well as a summer house. The front of the garden is great for relaxing and enjoying the afternoon sun.
To the front of the property there is space for parking of two cars as well as side access.
Brackley Square is a quiet family orientated turning that runs between Chigwell Road and Snakes Lane West. It is within catchment area of Ray Lodge Primary school and Woodbridge Secondary schools. Local amenities, shops and transport links including Woodford Station are close by also.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription: Located in an exclusive and extremely sought after building on Wanstead Place is this three-bedroom, first floor apartment, offering internal space of approximately 995 square feet. This rare Share of Freehold apartment is nestled in the heart of Wanstead Village on one of Wanstead&rsquo;s most popular roads. It offers three double bedrooms allowing ample space for large bedroom furniture as well as the option to use a bedroom as an office⁄study if required. The lounge has fantastic views overlooking Christchurch green and has excellent entertainment space with plenty of room for lounge⁄dining furniture whilst the family bathroom, fitted with an exquisite Villeroy and Boch vanity unit and bathroom suite, adds a touch of luxury. Finally, the generously spaced kitchen, fitted with high quality kitchen units, fully integrated appliances and granite worktops, provides access to the communal garden area and garage. Positioned close to Wanstead High Street this home is perfectly positioned for those wishing to have everything Wanstead has to offer at their fingertips including Snaresbrook Station and Wanstead Station which are only a short walk away. The outstanding local schools are ideal for families in the area whilst the local amenities of the High Street include an array of shops and restaurants including Gail&rsquo;s Bakery, Robin&rsquo;s Pie & Mash London and The Ginger Pig Butchers to name a few.

address: Cleveland Road, South Woodford, London E18
detailedDescription:
Guide Price £1,995,000 - £2,150,000 - Launch Day Saturday 17th July by Appointment - Redlands is a perfect fully detached five bedroom family home that measures almost 3000 sq ft.
Perfectly situated on this desirable pretty tree lined turning, Cleveland Road, close to George Lane shops, restaurants, café bars and South Woodford Central Line station, with excellent road connections for the M11, M25 and A406, and access to London City and London Stansted Airports.
Fully detached period homes rarely grace the market in South Woodford and therefore a viewing is highly recommended to appreciate what this property offers.

"Word from the owners - The deeds suggest the land was purchased in 1878 from the British Land Company and Redlands was built circa 1888 for a city businessman.
The double fronted Victorian house follows the ideals of the Victorians with the east west aspect. The master bedrooms facing east catch the morning sun and are cool in the evening. The west facing garden is bathed in sunlight throughout the day. The rooms are very spacious helped by the chimney breasts being located outside. All rooms are light and airy. The generous hallways have natural light from both the east and west.
The spacious basement has a dpc layer and concrete floor and provides ideal pantry overflow plus other storage. The coal hole and coal shoot have a toughened glass cover and allow day light into the basement.
The garage has been converted into a hobbies studio and general store. There are large deep sinks in the hobbies room and the adjacent utility room. The large loft is free of any plumbing or water tanks. It is partly boarded out and has two Velux windows. This is a valuable additional storage area.
The well-established back garden is laid to lawn with flowerbeds shrubs, fruit trees and vegetable area. Fortunately the neighbours are very respectful of privacy and noise so that the gardens are beautifully quiet for the blackbirds and other abundance of birds and wildlife."

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
An enviably appointed and perfectly placed three bedroom Edwardian mid-terrace, sat on a leafy no through road in the heart of Woodford. You have a wealth of lovingly preserved original features throughout, a breathtakingly sumptuous rear garden and plenty of potential to expand in the future.

Flawlessly finished throughout and with the substantial room sizes of the period, this is already the ideal family home with a wealth of sociable space, but with the loft space so far untouched you have sufficient scope to meet all your future needs, potentially adding your own whole new storey (subject to the usual permissions).

If you lived here…

You'll be luxuriating in over 1200 square feet of living space and a home that immediately impresses the second you step into the bright hallway. Lovingly restored vintage timber flooring runs underfoot and a pair of double internal doors on your right welcome you to the twenty six foot long through lounge. The original timber flows seamlessly in along with the floods of natural light from the classic Edwardian box bay window to the front and an original sash window framing leafy green garden views to the rear.

Your kitchen/diner is just as generous, the kitchen area neatly segmented by a timber-topped breakfast bar and home to a handsome suite of cream fitted cabinets and large Belfast sink. The dining space is full of light thanks to a double French doors and glazed surround bringing the outside in. And the outside is spectacular – a large patio gives way to an immaculately landscaped lawn, flanked by thriving beds and ending in a raised deck with summerhouse, all overseen by mature greenery.

Back inside and your master bedroom is a welcoming 220 square feet, with pale cream walls and carpet illuminated by another box bay window and secondary sash. There's a vintage fireplace with fitted floor to ceiling period wardrobes either side. Bedrooms two and three are no less impressive, both doubles of around 110 square feet apiece, cosily carpeted and with fine views of that fabulous garden. Finally your family bathroom is a vintage masterpiece, with a freestanding clawfoot tub and separate shower cubicle.

What else?

- You have ten primary/secondary schools rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted less than a mile away on foot. The 'Outstanding' Churchfields Primary is less than ten minutes' walk.
- South Woodford Central line station is around fifteen minutes on foot or nine by bike. From here it's just eighteen minutes direct to Liverpool Street and twenty seven to Tottenham Court Road.
- Elmhurst Gardens and Churchfield Recreation Ground are both on your doorstep, while venture further afield and you can be exploring Epping Forest in less than twenty minutes.

Bedroom (3.29m x 3.17m (10'9" x 10'4"))

A word from the owners... "I have lived in this road for 20 years and will be sad to leave. My kids have grown up here, going to Churchfields school, which is just a short walk over the bridge. When they were old enough it was lovely to be able to let them walk to school on their own, secure in the knowledge that once i'd seen them across the road there were no roads to cross. As the road is a cul-de-sac our children always felt safe to play out with their friends. They had water pistol fights in the Summer, Snowball fights in the Winter and Wynndale is famous for it's Halloween celebrations. The neighbours really are a lovely bunch. We have an active WhatsApp group, where we exchange useful information about issues affecting the road, recommendations for tradespeople and organise social activities. During lockdown we had a socially distanced D Day celebration party. The nicest compliment people pay me about my house is that it has a lovely feel. It is flooded with natural light, even on the gloomiest days. In the morning I like to sit with my cuppa in the sunny breakfast room with the French doors open, looking out at my garden, listening to the birds. We're not over-looked and there are many trees around - hence the birdsong. Another favourite space is my light and airy bedroom, with wall to wall windows.

It's really big so plenty of space to do my yoga! I love the fact that the station is a ten minute walk through Elmhurst Gardens, which is great for kids and dog walking. I hope whoever buys my house will be as happy here as I have been."

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £800,000-£850,000
Positioned on Dangan Road is this beautiful 2/3 bedroom chain free Victorian terraced home that has been tastefully decorated throughout and is enhanced by the properties original period features that consist of cast iron feature fireplaces, exposed wooden floors, high skirting and ornate coving to ceilings . We could not blame you for falling in love with this home before you even stepped over the threshold as you are greeted by the immaculate brick frontage, twin box bay sash windows and an ornate porch with mosaic tiled pathway.
They say that location is always important and with this property you have an array of amenities just minutes away that include Wanstead Station, the High Street with it's fantastic choice of shops and restaurants and Christ Church Green which is a great space to relax, run or take a stroll.
Internally this home does not disappoint with a light and airy open feel with open reception living and dining room leading to recently installed kitchen with feature butler sink and Corian worktops with a further utility area and downstairs W.C.
On the first floor there are three bedrooms, the third is just off the second and would make a great study or nursery, the main bedroom stretches across the width of the house with a large bay and further window. These houses come with a large loft so the potential for a loft conversion is always a possibility subject to the usual permissions. The bright bathroom is also located on the first floor.
Finally the rear garden has a mediterranean feel with it's grey slate shingles, large shrubs and raised patio area that laps up the sun the majority of the day with it's South/Westerly aspect.
A viewing on this home will certainly not disappoint so please contact us to arrange a time to take a look.

title: 2 bed maisonette for sale

address: Havering Gardens, Chadwell Heath, Essex RM6
detailedDescription:
With an attractive guide price of £500,000 - £525,000. Brian Thomas Estate Agents are delighted to offer for sale this exceptional fully extended three bedroom, bay fronted terraced family home offering both spacious living and modern decoration throughout. This lovely house is located on a very sought after tree lined turning close to amenities including local schools, day nurseries and transport links into London. The house boasts many fine features throughout including a ground floor shower room and spacious kitchen / diner, we highly advise an internal viewing to fully appreciate what this stunning family home has to offer.

Enclosed porch: Double glazed porch surround with double glazed door leading to secondary double glazed door:

Hallway: A spacious hallway with fitted carpet running the full length, it has a single radiator, electric point, under stairs storage cupboard housing meters and stairs to first floor landing.

Reception one: 15'2 x 11'8 (4.62 x 3.55m) As you walk into this lovely room the first thing you notice is the size of the living area offering plenty of entertainment space, a wood burner is the main focal point of room giving families the option to have a fire while relaxing together, fitted carpet runs the length of the room with a round bay window to the front elevation offering a stunning amount of natural light. It has multiple electric points, television point and radiator.

Reception two / dining room open plan to kitchen: 23'2 > 10'2 x 16'8 > 10'10 (7.05m > 3.1m x 5.07m > 3.3m)
Walking into the main family room the first thing you notice is the modern decoration and natural light coming in from the ceiling lantern over the dining area. Fitted carpet runs the length of the reception room with a gas feature fireplace with stone surround. The dining area offers plenty of space for families to eat together while looking over the rear garden.
The room opens up to the kitchen which has been expertly fitted with a range of units running along three walls comprising of an array of base cupboards, drawers and matching wall cabinets with under unit lighting. Long worktops with metro tiled walls incorporate the double bowl sink unit with chrome mixer taps. There is a 4-burner gas hob with extractor above, two eye level ovens have been installed plus there is a recess housing an integrated fridge and freezer plus additional shelving area. A wide breakfast bar offers under unit storage space which has plumbing for both washing machine and dishwasher. A double-glazed window and sliding patio doors to rear elevation offers more natural light.

Ground floor shower room -A great additional shower room with fully tiled floor and walls. It has a low-level W.C with dual flush, wall mounted vanity unit with cupboards and wash basin with chrome mixer tap, and a fully tiled walk-in shower with rain shower head, built in shelves and wall mounted chrome shower controls.

Landing: Fitted carpet, built in shelving unit, access to loft which is insulated and boarded, access is via a drop-down ladder.

Bedroom 1: 15'6 x 9'4 (4.72m x 2.84m) Walking into this spacious master bedroom the first thing you notice is how much natural light is being offered by the large bay window to front elevation. Fitted carpet runs the length of the room with fitted floor to ceiling wardrobes. There are multiple electric points, telephone point and radiator.

Bedroom 2: 14'2 x 11'2 (4.31m x 3.4m) Walking into this spacious second bedroom the first thing you notice is how much natural light is provided by the double glazed half bay window to rear elevation, fitted carpet runs the length of the room with a selection of built-in floor to ceiling wardrobes and matching drawers. It has multiple electric points, and radiator.

Bedroom 3: 8'8 x 6'4 (2.64m x 1.93m) Currently being used as a home office this generous sized third bedroom with a window to the front elevation offers plenty of natural light, there is fitted carpet, built in wardrobe and matching ceiling cupboards, multiple electric points and a single radiator. This would make a great child's bedroom or study.

Shower room: As you walk into this modern room the first thing you notice is how much natural light brightens the bathroom with a double glazed frosted window to rear elevation. It has been expertly fitted with a three-piece white suite comprising of a walk-in shower with wall mounted chrome shower controls, low level W.C with dual flush and floating vanity unit with drawer, white sink and chrome mixer tap. The floor and walls are fully tiled and it has a wall mounted heated towel rail and spot lit ceiling.

Rear garden: (70 Approx. Ft) This house has a large south facing garden consisting of a raised patio area ideal for entertaining or relaxing on those warm evenings with steps leading to the garden the remainder is lawn with selection of mature shrubs and borders, at the rear of the garden there is a secondary raised decked area with a summer house which makes a great additional room to enjoy while looking over the garden. There is also a secure pedestrian rear access leading to Havering Gardens.

Front garden: Off street parking via dropped kerb.

Location
Chadwell Heath station - 0.8 miles away - (connections towards London Liverpool Street)
Local schools - St Bede's, Grove Primary, Chadwell Heath Academy, Warren
Local supermarkets - Tesco's, Sainsburys, Lidl
Local day nurseries are within walking distance

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Located on popular Prospect Road is this stunning 2/3 bedroom period property. This extended Victorian house has been finished to a high standard and offers luxury living. Offers a fantastic kitchen diner and outhouse to the rear. Short walk to Woodford Central Line and amenities.

Guide Price £550,000 - £600,000

Situated in the heart of Woodford Green is this spectacular 2/3 bedroom extended house which ticks all the boxes for stunning living. This eye catching house is full of charm and has many period features including feature fireplaces, brick fronted and sash windows (double glazed sash being fitted).
The property offers so much character. Walking up to the house you can really appreciate the charm as you are greeted by a beautiful front door with tiled entrance. The property has been completely renovated by its current owner's and been finished to an exceptional standard with no expense spared.
The property has been extended to maximise space and has a beautiful contemporary feel. You can tell as soon as you step foot in the property that the house has been truly loved.

This elegant home offers off entrance hall, through lounge with bay window leading to the dining area and a luxury fitted kitchen. Off the kitchen is a further dining room with stunning tiled flooring and feature doors to patio area which is perfect for entertaining. The attraction does not stop there as the first floor contains 2 bedrooms and an exceptional family bathroom. The top floor has been converted into an useable loft room via a paddled staircase.

The garden has been very well maintained with a lawn, patio area where you can enjoy the alfresco dining, there is also a garden room to the rear which can be used as an office or studio.

The property truly offers the best of both worlds, being on the cusp of amazing open greens spaces whilst at the same time having all what Woodford has to offer on its door step.
Prospect Road is a sought after location which is perfect for commuters who travel into London via the Central Line. Woodford station is only a few minutes' walk and goes directly into Liverpool Street and the West End stations. Also close by are shops on Snakes Lane and other local amenities. Ray Lodge Park is a short walk which is a beautiful park for the whole family to enjoy, offers playing areas and tennis courts. Ray Lodge Primary School (Ofsted rated outstanding) are also within close proximity as well as many other popular schools.

detailedDescription:
Brand new refurbished, large one-bedroom ground floor flat located in a quiet Cul-de-Sac development and is only 10 minute walk from Goodmayes train station and close to shops, cafes and restaurants of both Goodmayes and Chadwell heath. Also, just a Two minute drive to the A12, for driving routes into Central London.

This is a great opportunity for first time buyers or investors as it was rented recently to the current owners at a good rental price before they purchased it!

title: 4 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Kevin&Co are delighted to offer this three bedroom terraced family home on Ascot Close. On the ground floor the property comprises a massive through-lounge with an abundance of retro features for you to build on, separate kitchen diner, and storage galore. The second floor comprises of two double bedrooms, a large single bedroom and a bathroom.

Externally the property comes with off street parking and lovely easy to maintain garden, separated into different areas with outside storage. To appreciate the full range of what is on offer, this home is a must view!

Art deco themes flow throughout this home providing the basis for strong interior delight. Changes to the interior provide a sense of spaciousness and room to relax. Externally, with room for at least three cars parking comfortably in the front, there will be no need to worry about permits or inspectors.

Curved walls and archways create a lofty appeal. Light flows throughout this house making it an ideal haven in the midst of the bustle. The vast lounge and kitchen with pristine decoration and floors are complete with numerous storage facilities that keep the space clean and uncluttered. The wonderful kitchen is a sight to behold offering smart yet casual living. Complemented with an adjacent dining area that opens out into the garden, you will feel like you are living the dream.

The cottage style back garden complements the art deco themes with plenty of areas for playing, socialising and storage.

Upstairs the two doubles and one single room as well as bathroom continue on with the art deco theme. There is room for an array of furniture that won’t detract from the flowing lines and easy maintenance floors. Overall, get ready to move into a substantial stylish home that awaits your presence.

detailedDescription:
Offered chain free and located just a short stroll away from the picturesque open green spaces of Epping Forest, is this bright and airy one bedroom ground floor flat with it's own easy to maintain rear garden. Local amenities and popular George Lane, which hosts an array of eateries, bars and boutiques are located within good access, along with access to South Woodford Central Line tube station.

Comprising: Entrance via a communal door and hallway leading to your own front door, you will first find yourself at the bedroom, which is located to the front of the property. Just behind the bedroom is the spacious living area, which has access into the rear garden and also leads seamlessly into the bright and airy kitchen / diner.

This kitchen is complete with fitted wall and base units, tiled surround, integrated oven & hob and bay window located to the side, creating the perfect spot to sit back, relax and enjoy your morning cup of coffee.

Lastly located to the rear of the property is a small lobby area in which you can gain access into the shower room suite and conservatory, which leads out into the rear garden.

Externally: This property has an easy to maintain garden with shed, providing this home with a lovely outdoor space to be enjoyed, especially during the warmer months.

In Addition:

- Great access to odeon cinema, Nando's and Pizza Express

- Waitrose supermarket located close-by

- Road links incl. A406 & M11

title: 2 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
Within 400ft of Wanstead's popular High Street, Roca Court is a popular development noted for its striking modern design, manicured frontage and gated underground parking facilities. Being within 0.2 and 0.5 Miles from both Snaresbrook and Wanstead Central Line Stations' and 0.2 Miles from Christchurch Green, the centrality of the development makes it perfect for those wanting to easily access everything this popular East London suburb has to offer.

Located on the ground floor of the development, the apartment is easily accessible once you are through the security entry doors, and once inside the feeling of space and light is immediately noticeable with a wide hallway opening onto a generous lounge/diner with views over the property's private terrace. There is a separate modern kitchen adjacent from the living/dining room keeping cooking smells at bay without hindering easy entertaining. The family bathroom has space for a bath with shower overhead and both bedrooms are a good size with the master bedroom enjoying the use of an en-suite shower room.

Externally the property enjoys a large, private terrace spanning just over 25ft in width at the largest point, with direct access onto the immaculate communal gardens beyond. With both areas enjoying a Westerly aspect the sun can be enjoyed from early afternoon until late evening, making the outside space a fantastic area to host family and friends whilst making the most of the fair weather. There is also secure, allocated underground parking which can be a real rarity for such a central location.

A fantastic family home, bright and airy and immaculately presented throughout situated in a quite residential turning.

Enjoy easy access to Chadwell Heath Station taking you into London Liverpool Street Station in just 20 minutes, making this ideal for the London commuter.

detailedDescription:
Set back off the High Road is this modern luxury 1 bedroom apartment. The property is in excellent condition throughout and offers sole use outside space and gated secure allocated parking. Short walk to Central Line station, open green spaces and amenities.

Guide Price £325,000 - £340,000

Set back off the High Road is the ever popular Lilac House, a secure and sought after development. The apartment is located on the ground floor and boasts an unique sole use courtyard space to the rear.
This spectacular 1 bedroom modern apartment has been finished to an excellent standard and has been well maintained by its current owners. There is a luxury fitted kitchen diner leading to a lounge. The bedroom is a good size and offers a modern bathroom.
The property benefits include a secure gated entrance with allocated parking, integrated alarm system and entry phone.

Lilac House itself is a popular location with open green spaces such as Woodford Golf Course and Epping Forest close by, whilst still being close to Woodford High Road amenities. Woodford Central Line station is only a short walk away and the property also benefits from many restaurants on its door step, such as the Italian Bel Sit, Miller & Carter, Mezze and Prezzo. Being so close to all that Woodford offers, whilst having the forest on its door step and good transport links, really makes this well maintained development an attractive place to live.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
An opportunity to purchase a four bedroom family home has arisen in a peaceful IG7 residential turning.

Boasting a 19ft x 14ft reception room, ground floor WC plus first floor separate WC and bathroom, detached garage and from the rear is completely sheltered and unoverlooked.

We invite interested parties to contact our sales team today to arrange an internal inspection.

This family home definitely is a property viewing that should not be missed.

From the moment you enter the quiet residential close you can feel the warmth that the location emits!

With a lawned green to the front of the turning and picturesque views of London/Essex you can feel that your children are safe at all times from the dangers of the main road.

Upon entering the property you are met with spacious rooms and light and airy feelings throughout, due to several rooms offering sunlight from both the front and rear aspects.

The rear garden can be located from three points, the entrance hall, kitchen and also from the rear access road to the detached garage.

Families of all ages can benefit from spacious rooms, a great central location within catchment to several Primary and Secondary schools alongside private nurseries for those with children under school age.

The local bus route could not be closer found at the bottom of the turning and grange hill station is 800 yards away.

Having been lovingly owned by the sellers for over 15 years they are now looking to downsize and pass the house over to another family looking to make a house their home.<br /><br />

title: 2 bed flat for sale

address: The Roses, High Road, Woodford Green IG8
detailedDescription: *Guide Price £225,000 - £235,000* This well proportioned two bedroom, top floor apartment is in good condition throughout, in the center of town and is offered to the market chain free. Walking in you find a large reception room awash with natural light and bay window, large master bedroom, second bedroom ideal as a guest room or even a work form home office, separate modern kitchen and a modern bathroom with separate shower. This apartment further benefits from new carpets throughout, feature fireplace in the reception room and master bedroom, excellent storage space, full double glazing and gas central heating. The accommodation has been recently decorated in neutral colours and modern fittings with a tiled kitchen and bathroom. South Woodford Central Line Station is a stroll away making commuting a breeze and the property benefits from easy access to A406 and M11. There is also a wealth of local amenities on your doorstep including a Tesco and a Waitrose within walking distance and ideally located for access to Epping Forest. One of the oldest buildings in Woodford, The George Pub, is located on the corner of the High Road, next door to the Odeon Cinema – a listed building. As you walk towards the central line station you will pass a variety of trendy bars, cafes and restaurants.

detailedDescription:
Description

Triple 4 Group are pleased to present for sale this fantastic three bedroom house. This house provides an ideal family home for a first-time buyer or for someone looking to get on the property ladder as an investor. This is a three bed with one bathroom house situated in a pleasant residential area with excellent views of valentines park. Situated just off Ley Street, there are excellent transport links to both Ilford, Stratford and Liverpool Street. There are local bus routes which take you into Ilford Town Centre. In addition, there is easy access by car for both the A12 & A406. The property is located within easy reach of several outstanding schools, both primary and secondary. The property has two good-sized living rooms, is well maintained and has ample storage space.

The house comprises of the following fantastic features;

detailedDescription:
Modern one bedroom purpose built upper floor flat in IG7. The property is in great condition throughout and still benefits from the new build warranty. As you enter the property you are met by a spacious hallway with access to all of the rooms. The very stylish double bedroom has a range of fitted wardrobes and panelled feature wall. The property offers modern open plan living room incorporating the kitchen and dining area, the kitchen is finished with smart white units and black worktops with complementing wall tiles and French doors lead from the lounge out to the private balcony. The contemporary shower room is fully tiled and has access to great eaves storage.
The development has secure, gated underground parking and entry phone system.
Grange Hill Station and Hainault Station (Central Line) are 0.8 and 1.4 miles away respectively. The local area offers array of shops and the popular Hainault Forest Country Park is also close by. There are also good transport links via road.

title: 4 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
An elegant and well presented four bedroom period house situated on a sought after road within 0.2 miles from the Central line and Wanstead High Street.

Location

Dangan Road is a sought after turning within Wanstead being 0.2 miles from both the Central line and Wanstead High Street.

Local amenities on Wanstead High Street include many indepedent cafes, bars and restaurants, boutique shops as well as the more widely recognised brands such as The Co-Op, Boots and Costa Coffee. There are also three well regarded pubs, The Duke, The Cuckfield and The Bull.

If schooling is a consideration then you really are spoilt for choice. There are twelve primary/secondary schools within a one mile radius alone that are currently rated 'good' or 'outstanding' by Ofsted. Wanstead Church Primary School is 0.2 miles, Wanstead High School is 0.6 miles, Nightingale Primary School is 0.8 miles and Forest School is also 0.8 miles away.

For the outdoors type, there are many green opens spaces nearby including Epping Forest which is 0.4 miles leading to Hollow Ponds where you can hire row boats.

When travelling by car you're very well connected both into London and out of London being 0.2 miles from the A12 which joins the M11, Junction 12 (approximately 2.5 miles away) and meets the M25 at Junction 6.

All distances above are approximate and school Ofsted ratings may differ.

Description

This elegant four bedroom Edwardian property offers character and charm throughout with many of its period features being restored and retained by the current owners.

As you enter through the front door you are welcomed by a typical Edwardian entrance hall complete with original tiled flooring and ornate cornicing. The main reception room sits at the front of the house and offers a wealth of period features including an original fireplace (in full working order), high ceilings and large bay window flooding the room with natural light.

The kitchen has been extended and now offers a generous open plan kitchen/dining space with high quality limestone flooring and underfloor heating. Furthermore, there is a double oven, built-in microwave, and two full-length larder cupboards.
The ground floor also comprises a downstairs w/c and under-stairs storage for shoes and coats.

Upstairs you will find three bedrooms and a family bathroom, two of the bedrooms are generous sized doubles with bedroom two benefiting from a large bay window and built in cupboard.

A recent addition is the spacious loft conversion providing a large fourth bedroom suite. There are Velux windows to the front where the en suite shower room is located and to the rear the floor to ceiling window brings the outside in. There is also storage in the eaves.

Externally, the west facing garden offers a patio area accessed from the kitchen, the rest is laid to lawn. To the front of the property there is a small paved area with brick wall that has been recently re-conditioned.

Square Footage: 1474 sq ft

detailedDescription:
James Hilton House is ideally placed for Snaresbrook and South Woodford Central Line Stations (0.4 and 0.7 Miles respectively) and the amenities including restaurants, shops and bars within George Lane and Wanstead High Street. Surrounded by beautifully maintained communal gardens to the rear and off street parking with splendid views of the prestigious Drive to the front, this converted Georgian apartment is well situated within substantial grounds. With high ceilings and sash windows, the spacious accommodation still maintains a sense of grandeur and the well laid out accommodation flows well throughout.

You are welcomed into the home via a spacious hallway which gives way to all available rooms in the apartment. To the right there are two charming bedrooms, both with sash windows and views over the Drive. The modern bathroom is adjacent to both bedrooms and offers a full sized bath with shower overhead and surrounding white suite. The real showstopper is the incredible kitchen/reception room to the rear with a stunning central bay housing three floor-to-ceiling windows offering views over the immaculate communal gardens. The stylish room with its wooden flooring and crisp, white walls offers plenty of space to house a large sofa with room enough for a separate dining table. The modern kitchen opens onto the lounge/diner making the room a wonderful space to entertain and socialise with friends and family.

detailedDescription:
Open House Saturday 10th July - Guide Price £400,000 - £425,000 This is a no chain sale - A Bright and Spacious Two Double Bedroom Terraced House with garage and private rear garden. This Freehold House features an 18’8” reception, separate Fitted Kitchen/Diner, two double bedrooms, Bathroom/wc with Shower, a large private garden with rear access, and a separate Garage. Scoter Close is ideally tucked away in a Cul-de-sac location within a short walk to Woodford Central Line Station. There is a huge variety of local amenities at The Broadway or The High Road or Snakes Lane, all within a short walk and offering a choice of independent shops, restaurants, and coffee shops. There are many outstanding Schools close by too. To cap it all, Woodford Green also offers a range of forests, lakes, country parks and open green spaces. This House is an ideal starter home and perfect for a first-time buyer, buy-to-let investor or someone looking to downsize.

Viewings can be booked and confirmed instantly 24/7 via the Purple Bricks website or by Clicking on the Brochure Tab at the bottom of this Advert.

Double glazed window with garden aspect, radiator, door to rear garden.

Positioned on the ground floor of this grand Victorian conversion, the property was originally laid out as a two bedroom home but later converted with the former kitchen moving into what was the second bedroom to provide a separate kitchen area. The home is in need of complete refurbishment, but this would allow the new owner to potentially move the kitchen back into the main living area, creating a two bedroom apartment again, or for the property to be simply styled to the new owners tastes and requirements. Currently the property consists of a spacious double bedroom, bathroom, separate kitchen and bright living room with double doors opening onto a large, impressive private garden. The property further benefits from communal parking to the front as well as a share of the freehold.

The property is conveniently located a short distance from Newbury Park Central Line Station (0.7 miles) and Seven Kings tfl Rail station which will benefit from Cross Rail (0.3 Miles) as well as several regular bus routes offering easy access to the surrounding area, such as Ilford and Romford town centres.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This 4 bedroom detached home located in a popular cul-de-sac on the popular Monkhams Estate offers great size accommodation along with huge potential to extend or even rebuild. The property is chain free.

Located on the exclusive Monkhams Estate is Nursery Road, a quiet sought after cul-de-sac which is a residential family road.

This bright and spacious four bedroom detached home has a surrounding garden which at the rear has a lovely high wall. Once inside there is a good sized hallway with a large through lounge, good sized kitchen, further reception, utility room, bathroom and a cloakroom. Upstairs there are four bedrooms with the master having a dressing room and a bathroom.

The home has fantastic potential as there is planning permission for a new build or extension possibilities and variations to the existing building. Groundwork investigations, the drainage design, sustainability reports, suds design, CCTV surveys, structural and technical drawings and CGI drawings have all been completed.

Nursery Road is a quiet road and provides the perfect balance of local amenities and leafy green areas. There are also local shops, cafes and restaurants with The Broadway and The High Road close by. Being located on this sought after road you are within a short stroll to Woodford Central Line station which is perfect for your daily commute. M25 & M11 junctions are also within easy reach. If it's good schools that you are looking for, there is an excellent choice for many popular private and state schools close by which makes this beautiful home in an ideal position for a family to settle down in.

There are many open green spaces within a short walk such as Knighton Woods and Epping Forest where the whole family can enjoy the great outdoors.

address: Gordon Road, South Woodford, London E18
detailedDescription:
Located on a residential turning is this charming 3 bedroom Victorian house which is full of character and offering many period features. The property is in excellent condition and offers accommodation over 3 floors. Close to George Lane shops, Woodford Green amenities, schools and Central Line.

Guide Price £600,000 - £650,000

Located on a popular residential road on the South Woodford and Woodford Green borders is this spectacular 3 bedroom Victorian mid terraced house which ticks all the boxes for excellent living. This eye catching house is full of charm and has many period features including coving, wood flooring and amazing feature fireplaces. The property offers so much character, walking up the pavement you can really appreciate the charm, as you will see an eye catching bay window and a tiled entrance. This brick fronted house has been well maintained by its current owner and is in immaculate condition throughout. You can tell as soon as you step foot in the property that the house has been truly loved.
This elegant home offers spacious accommodation over 3 floors and is very light and airy. The lower ground floor consists of a 14ft lounge, ground floor W.C, contemporary style fitted kitchen leading to a dining room. The attraction does not stop there as the upper ground floor contains a stunning entrance hall, 2nd bedroom and an exceptional family bathroom. The master and 3rd bedrooms are set on the first floor.
The garden is a good size and has lawn with flower and shrub borders, patio area where you can enjoy alfresco dining and a further seating to the rear.

The property truly offers the best of both worlds, being on the cusp of amazing open greens spaces whilst at the same time having all that South Woodford has to offer on its door step.
Gordon Road is widely known as one of South Woodford's most appealing residential roads in this sought after neighbourhood. This popular family road contains some of the area's finest period houses and is ideally situated for local amenities with shops, bars and restaurants nearby. Transport links are excellent with South Woodford and Woodford Central Line close by, M25 & M11 junctions are also within easy reach. The house lies within the vicinity of many popular schools and bus routes.

detailedDescription:
Close to both South Woodford Station and Snaresbrook Central Line stations' (0.4 and 0.5 Miles respectively) as well as both George Lane shops and Wanstead High Street, both with an eclectic mix of bars, bistros and shops, this property is close to all local amenities. A few hundred yards away there is also a small parade including a corner shop and fantastic local restaurants, including the Ark fish restaurant and ever popular Sakura sushi and buns.

The property itself sits on a deep plot with an impressive gated frontage providing parking for several cars. The double height bay with sash windows, exposed brick frontage and ornate double entrance door all creating a memorable first impression. Once inside the high ceilings, naturally bright rooms and grand proportions cannot fail to impress, with the double reception room spanning just under 30 feet and currently housing a good sized sofa suite and large library area. Behind the reception there is a generous separate utility room with adjoining W.C providing plenty of space for washer/dryer, large double butler sink and a range of cabinets. The direct side access to the utility makes the space ideal for the convenient removal of household waste and ideal boot room for muddy boots or pets. The kitchen diner to the rear also provides plenty of storage as well as space for a six seater dining table, however there is further potential to increase the floor space and re-design the kitchen by way of rear extension if desired (stpc). There is also a handy cellar accessible from this floor.

To the first floor there are three double bedrooms, the largest enjoying the wide bay frontage and rear bedroom having the advantage of an adjoining dressing room. The family bathroom also has plenty of room to house a roll top bath and separate shower. The loft has been converted to provide a master bedroom with bespoke cabinetry providing plenty of storage space and modern en-suite shower room. The rear West facing garden is equally as spacious and impressive as the house measuring approximately 123 feet in length and enjoying the afternoon sun until late evening. With a large patio area accessible immediately from the kitchen/diner and leading down to a beautifully maintained lawn and large outbuilding the garden is practical and easy to maintain but also provides a new owner the option to further landscape to their own requirements given the generous size and favourable facing.

Kings Group are delighted to offer this fantastic opportunity to purchase a stylish 2 bedroom 2 bathroom apartment located within a stones throw of Gants Hill Station.
Convenience reaches new levels with a range of amenities on the doorstep including excellent primary and secondary schools, supermarkets, doctors surgeries, trendy restaurants to dine in and more! Valentines Park is nearby too meaning this property can't be more ideally situated!

Located in the much sought after 'Citygate House' development, this stylish apartment has been recently redecorated in modern neutral colours and has a spacious and warm feel throughout. The large living room features sliding doors that open onto the balcony overlooking the lovely garden surroundings, whilst the newly fitted kitchen is sure to impress friends and family with the superior craftsmanship and quality of materials used.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Churchill Estates are favoured to offer for sale this four bedroom 1930's family home, centrally located in a prime position with stunning views overlooking the picturesque Christchurch Green. This beautifully presented property has been thoughtfully extended and lovingly renovated to a high standard throughout by the current vendors.

The ground floor consists of a generous front reception with feature fireplace and interconnecting doors leading to the bright and spacious extended open plan kitchen/dining room, which is flooded with natural light thanks to the large bi fold doors and three sky lights above. The kitchen also features a large island with sink insert, integrated dishwasher, breakfast bar, ample additional worktop space and storage as well as a utility cupboard that houses the washing machine and tumble dyer.

The first floor comprises a main bedroom affording beautiful views of Christchurch Green with fitted wardrobes, second generous double bedroom overlooking the rear garden, third bedroom being a good size single or office/study and a contemporary four piece bathroom suite with underfloor heating. The converted loft space now incorporates a spacious and airy double bedroom with additional en-suite bathroom and ample built in storage cupboards.

Further benefits include a well maintained rear garden with patio area to laid lawn, useful ground floor WC, double glazing and central heating throughout, private driveway with off street parking for two vehicles and a good size outbuilding that comes complete with power, lighting, heating and a separate storage room adjoining.

For further details or to book an appointment to view, please contact the office at your earliest convenience.

Four bedrooms - Freehold

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Kings Group estate agents are proud to present this beautiful one bedroom ground floor conversion property. The property benefits of a lease with 155 years remaining and is located on the gorgeous tree-lined street of Selborne Road. You are greeted at the property by a paved front garden which benefits from a drop kerb and one allocated space for parking. The communal entrance opens into a large entrance hall that gives access to your main front door. As you enter the property you are presented with a spacious and bright reception room. The room benefits from a sizeable bay window that floods the room with natural light as well as adding extra floor area to this already generous room. The reception room leads into the fully fitted kitchen. The kitchen was recently updates and benefits from integrated appliances. The kitchen gives access to an adequate lobby area with added storage space. The lobby gives access to a large double bedroom with views of the private rear garden. On the other side of the lobby a spacious three piece bathroom can be found. This room has been finished to a very high standard and was just completed this year. Back into the kitchen and you come across the rear patio door that leads into your private garden. The garden is south/west facing and at just under 50ft long it is ideal for entertaining in the summer months. The property also benefits from fully double glazed windows as well as gas central heating from a Worchester combination boiler that has been regularly serviced. The property is located a stones throw away from Ilford station which is on the tfl line and is a short 12 minute ride into Stratford station. Ilford high street is also within walking distance and has a variety of shops, pubs and restaurants so you have ample amounts of amenities right on your doorstep.

title: 4 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £550,000 - £575,000 - A spacious four bedroom, two bathroom end terrace house with garage. Located in Woodford Green under a mile to the tube station and within a short walk of local shopping, bars, cafes, eateries and highly rated Schools. Please note: This property is offered to the market with no onward chain. Internally, the well-proportioned family accommodation is arranged to provide an entrance hallway, Lounge which is open to the Dining Room and Annex/Garden Room with patio doors to the Private rear garden and a Separate Newly Fitted Kitchen. The first floor boasts a family bathroom and three bedrooms. The Second Floor offers the Master Bedroom 18’8” x 13’9” with a modern En-Suite Bathroom. Externally, to the front of the property there is potential for off-street parking (subject to permission). The Rear Garden has side access and rear access to the detached garage and workshop.

Viewings can be booked and confirmed instantly 24/7 via the Purple Bricks website or Via Rightmove by Clicking on the Brochure Tab at the bottom of the Rightmove Advert.

Location: This property is in an excellent location, in the heart of Woodford Bridge ideally situated with a choice of local shops, cafes, restaurants and eateries. For City workers the property is located close to Central Line Stations including, Woodford Green (0.8 mi), Roding Valley (1.0 mi), Chigwell (1.3 mi) and Roding Lane Bus Stop (250ft). This house is also within easy reach of Chigwell & Abridge Village.
It is also ideally located for local schools including Roding Primary School, Ray Lodge Primary School and West Hatch which are Ofsted rated as "Outstanding".

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Madison Fox are delighted to present to the market this most impressive double fronted six bedroom executive residence with accommodation arranged over three floors situated within this gated development. Although already a substantial property there is scope for a double storey side extension subject to the usual permissions.

The property benefits include a spacious entrance hall, modern fully fitted kitchen/diner with adjacent utility room, cloakroom, double aspect living room and family room. On the first floor there are three double bedrooms all with en-suite facilities whilst on the second floor there are three further double bedrooms which share a family bathroom.

To the front of the property there is a block paved driveway providing off street parking which allows access to the detached double garage with electric up and over doors power and light and side access to the rear of the property which comprises of a patio area with the remainder laid to lawn.

Repton Park is located within easy reach of Woodford Central Line Stations which offer easy access into London. Also within close proximity is the ever popular parade of shops on High Road (Woodford) and Brook Parade (Chigwell) with their comprehensive range of shops, boutiques, eateries and restaurants. Further local amenities include, Virgin Active Premier Club Repton Park and Tescos Superstore. The area offers a range of access to primary and secondary schools, both private and state. By car M25 (junction 26) and M11 (Junction 5 - Southbound) are within easy reach.

Originally Claybury Hospital, Repton Park was sympathetically developed by Crest Nicholson in conjunction with English Heritage and the London Wildlife Trust, converting the original buildings and adding new houses and apartments. Arguably the local areas most prestigious development further benefits include on site CCTV, 24hr concierge service, Virgin Active spa and gym, allocated and visitor parking and approximately 235 acres of landscaped grounds.

agency_name: John D Wood & Co. - Loughton Sales
detailedDescription:
Four bedroom semi-detached chalet bungalow in Woodford IG8.

As you enter the porch on the ground floor you are greeted by a spacious entrance hall with doors leading to the reception, kitchen, two double bedrooms, family bathroom and stairs up to the first floor.

The dual aspect reception is a fantastic space with a large bay window one end and French doors leading out to the south facing garden at the other. The kitchen is bright with views over the garden with modern white fitted units and also allows direct access to the garden. The family bathroom is a good size with floor to ceiling tiles, a white bathroom suite with bath (and overhead shower), sink and WC. Both the bedrooms are generous in size, one benefiting from a large bay window. On the first floor there are two further double bedrooms and a shower room.

Outside to the rear the garden benefits from a decked area leading to the lawn, there is also access from the garden to the office space to the rear of the garage. The front drive provides off street parking for several cars.

The location is great for commuters and families with plenty of options for travel and schooling. Woodford Central Line Underground is just 0.8 miles away and South Woodford Central line is just 0.6 miles away both with a range of restaurants, shops, cafes, bars and South Woodford Odeon Cinema. Churchfield’s Infant and Primary School is 0.6 miles away and Woodbridge High School is just 0.2 miles from the property.

The property will be sold chain free and viewings can start from Monday 19th July by appointment only.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented two-bedroom split level flat with own private garden, located within 0.8 mile of Woodford Central Line Station. This End of terrace duplex flat is modern in décor with a stylish fitted kitchen, a large living room with direct access to a private patio garden. Upstairs offers two double bedrooms and a well-presented bathroom/wc. There is also an external storage space to keep your bike safe.

Whilst you can use the communal entrance into this flat it is actually easier to enter through your own private door into the lounge which opens to the garden patio area. We also understand the property is fitted with a Flatmaster air filter system; The system introduces air into the home at a continuous low rate, eliminating condensation dampness and forcing out indoor pollutants such as Radon gas and carbon monoxide. Length of Lease 106 years unexpired Ground Rent £10 pa Service Charge approx. £607 pa & Insurance approx. £200 pa

Location: Claybury Park is only a short walk away and there are local sports clubs and athletic tracks nearby. Schools in the area are highly regarded too.
The immediate area surrounding this property offers a whole host of amenities overlooking the Green at Woodford Bridge including a supermarket, many shops, eateries, restaurants, and coffee shops.
For those seeking quieter pursuits the local fishing lake and parks means that you can jog, cycle, fish or take a picturesque leisurely walk.

Viewings can be booked and confirmed instantly 24/7 via the Purple Bricks website.

address: St. Mary's Lodge, St Mary's Avenue, Wanstead E11
detailedDescription:
Situated in the sought-after St. Mary's Lodge on the prestigious St. Mary's Avenue, overlooking George Green, this purpose built complex is within easy reach of Wanstead Central Line Station and High Street (0.2 miles), with its array of shops and restaurants.

The communal entrance hall is accessed via a secure entry phone system and then there is a lift that takes you up to the spacious apartment. Stepping inside, the large inviting hallway sets an impressive tone that continues throughout. The well-proportioned rooms all have large windows, which ensures the home enjoys plenty of natural light. The accommodation is comprised of two double bedrooms, a fitted bathroom, a large lounge/dinner and a separate kitchen/breakfast room, which has a good deal of fitted storage. The master bedroom and the kitchen enjoy tranquil, pretty views of the beautifully kept and secluded communal gardens, which all residents can enjoy throughout the year. The property also has the benefit of secured underground parking, visitors parking to the front, a share of the freehold and a long lease!

Please note that this property is for sale by the Modern Method of Auction which is not to be confused with Traditional auction. The Modern Method of Auction is a flexible buyer-friendly method of purchase. We do not require the buyer to exchange contracts immediately, but grant 28 days to achieve exchange of contracts from the date the buyer's solicitor is in receipt of the draft contracts and a further 28 days thereafter to complete. Allowing the additional time to exchange on the property means interested parties can proceed with traditional residential finance. Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer will be required to put down a non-refundable Reservation Fee of 3.6% (inclusive of VAT) subject to a minimum of £6,000 (inclusive of VAT) which secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. The buyer will be required to sign an Acknowledgment of Reservation form to confirm acceptance of terms prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation form and all terms and conditions can be found in the Legal Pack which can be downloaded for free from the auction section of our website or requested from our Auction Department.

Please note this property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price which is generally no more than 10% in excess of the Starting Bid. Both the Starting Bid and Reserve Price can be subject to change. Our primary duty of care is to the vendor. Terms and conditions apply to the Modern Method of Auction, which is operated by Douglas Allen powered by iam-sold Ltd.

All dimensions are approximate and quoted for guidance only as are floor plans which are not to scale and their accuracy cannot be confirmed. Reference to appliances and/or services does not imply that they are necessarily in working order or fit for the purpose.

title: 3 bed end terrace house for sale

address: Percival Gardens, Romford, Greater London RM6
detailedDescription:
Key features:
  • *Guide Price £580,000 - £600,000*
  • Versatile End Terrace House
  • Rear & Loft Extensions
  • Five Good Size Bedrooms
  • Bathroom, WC & Shower Room
  • Two Spacious Reception Rooms
  • Large Garden with Outbuilding
  • Driveway for Two Vehicles
  • Close to Amenities, Schools & Transport Links
  • Ideal for Families & Investors

Full description:
The Express Estate Agency is proud to offer this Five Bedroom End Terrace House – all interest and offers are invited.

*Guide Price £580,000 - £600,000*

internal:
Entrance - The front entrance door opens to the porch, with front aspect windows and a door to the hall.
Hall - With the staircase leading up to the first floor landing and doors to the lounge and the kitchen.
Lounge - Offering generous space for furniture, with a front aspect bay window, a feature fireplace and a sliding door to the dining room.
Dining Room - Ample space for a table and chairs and additional furniture, with a rear aspect window, French doors to the rear and an opening to the kitchen.
Kitchen - Fitted with a range of wall and base units with complimenting worktops. Inset stainless steel sink basin with a drainer and mixer tap, and both space and plumbing for appliances.

First Floor Landing - With the staircase leading up to the second floor landing and doors to bedrooms one, two and three, the WC and the bathroom.
Bedroom One - Large double size room with a front aspect bay window and a range of fitted wardrobes.
Bedroom Two - Double size room with a rear aspect window and a range of fitted wardrobes.
Bedroom Three - Single size room with a front aspect window and a fitted wardrobe.
Bathroom - Comprising a pedestal wash hand basin, a panelled bath with a handheld shower mixer, and a rear aspect obscure window.
WC - Separate to the bathroom, a push-button WC with a rear aspect obscure window.

Second Floor Landing - With doors to bedrooms four and five, and the shower room.
Bedroom Three - Large double size room with a rear aspect window.
Bedroom Five - Large double size room with two front aspect Velux windows.
Shower Room - Comprising a push-button WC, a pedestal wash hand basin and a shower enclosure, with a rear aspect obscure window.

External:
Front - Brick-paved driveway providing off-road parking space for two vehicles.
Rear - Spacious garden with a paved patio area and a lawned area with plant beds and mature shrubs and trees. Outbuilding to the rear end with ample space for storage.

Early viewing is highly recommended due to the property being realistically priced.

A rare chance for people over the age of 55 to purchase this vacant, taylor wimpey built 1st floor retirement flat, situated in this highly sought after block of 24 flats, that was built in 2005. Fitted bedroom: 14'4 X 10'1 - bathroom/W.C. - lounge: 15'6 X 14'5 - fitted kitchen: 10'4 X 8'10 - UPVC double glazing - allocated parking space - gas central heating - communal lounge - house manager - communal gardens.

Entrance hall

Giving access to all accommodation, radiator, airing cupboard housing central heating boiler, power points, door to:-
Lounge

UPVC double glazed door and windows with Juliet balcony, overlooking the communal rear gardens, radiator, power points, t.v. And telephone points.
Fitted kitchen (with windows)
Range of fitted base and eye level units with stainless steel sink with mixer tap, working surfaces with cupboards and drawers beneath, integrated fridge/freezer, dishwasher and washing machine, built-in oven and 4-ring gas hob with extractor over, wall and floor tiling, upvc double glazed windows overlooking the rear gardens, radiator, telephone, and power points.
Bedroom

An extensive range of fitted wardrobes and drawer units, upvc double glazed door and windows with Juliet balcony overlooking the rear gardens, radiator, power points, telephone point.

Modern white suite comprising, walk-in bath, with door with mixer tap, shower attachment, low level w.c., pedestal wash hand basin, expelair fan, tiling.

For residents there is a communal hall, as well as communal gardens.

Outgoings

The ground rent is £200.00 per annum and the maintenance is currently in the region of £260.00 per month which includes water rates and building insurance. Tax Band - D £1,405.35

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
This delightful three bedroom extended semi detached property is situated within very close walking distance to Hainault Central line Underground Station. With a 27ft long through lounge with an open flue should you wish to have a live fire, a good size modern kitchen with a granite worktop that leads out to a well maintained approx. 70ft garden with it's rose bushes and a garage at the rear of the garden access at the rear from a share alley driveway. There is parking also at the rear by the garage for a car on the hard standing and parking on the drive to the front of the property for two cars. The property comes with a fully serviced alarm system which is also connected to the garage.On the first floor you will find two large light and airy double bedrooms with fitted wardrobes, a third smaller bedroom and a four piece family bathroom with it's own separate power shower and a jacuzzi bath plus fitted with speakers in the ceiling for it's integrated sound system.This property has the potential to expand further with extending into the loft area (subject to planning consents). There is side access to the property along a shared drive. To fully appreciate this property viewing is highly recommended.

Garage to the rear
Parking on the front drive and at the rear for several cars
Four piece bathroom
Very Close walking distance to Hainault Underground Station

title: 3 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
This linked detached property is just a short stroll from George Lane with its eclectic mix of shops, bars, restaurants and South Woodford Central Line Station.

Once inside the spacious accommodation can be fully appreciated. A welcoming entrance hallway serves two reception rooms. The sitting room has a large bay window, ensuring the room is flooded by natural light whilst the feature fireplace gives the area a cosy feel. To the rear of the house, the dining room enjoys garden views from the patio doors.
The kitchen is fitted with a range of wood cabinets with contrasting work surfaces and integrated appliances. A deep cupboard offers useful storage space.

On the first floor there are three bedrooms, the principle with a range of fitted wardrobes. The fully tiled bathroom is fitted with a white suite and completes the accommodation.

The rear garden is approx. 72' in length and commences with a large decked terrace with plenty of space for a table and chairs whilst the block paved frontage provides parking and serves the attached garage.

As well as the Central Line Station transport links include easy access to the M11, M25 and North Circular.

detailedDescription:
Madison Fox are delighted to present to the market this well presented five bedroom semi-detached family home located in this popular and quiet turning close to Barkingside High Street, local shops and amenities and highly sought after schools including Beale and Ilford County High.

The property is approached by a spacious frontage with ample off street parking. The ground floor provides a spacious hallway with guest w/c, a large living/dining room, play room and kitchen/breakfast room which leads to an undercover terrace overlooking the rear garden .

The first floor has four bedrooms one of which is en-suite and a family bathroom with the second floor offering a further double bedroom with an en-suite bathroom.

The front drive is paved and offers ample off street parking and the rear garden has a covered terrace with the remainder mainly laid to lawn with a garden room/gym to the rear.

Ryecroft Avenue is conveniently placed near a selection of primary, secondary and faith schools with high reputations including Beale and Ilford County High, a short walk to local amenities, and the huge choice of shops and restaurants in Barkingside High Street. Redbridge Sports Centre is nearby and Claybury Park which hosts fantastic nature trails, play areas and a lake is around the corner. There is easy access into London via a choice of Central Line stations including Fairlop, Barkingside, Woodford and South Woodford, alternatively by car via the A12, A406 and M11.

This method of auction requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days of the draft contract for sale being received by the buyers solicitor. This additional time allows buyers to proceed with mortgage finance (subject to lending criteria, affordability and survey).
The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation
Fee. This being 4.2% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000.00 including VAT.
The Reservation Fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable
consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Buyers will be required to go through an identification verification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded.
This property has a Buyer Information Pack which is a collection of documents in relation to the property. The
documents may not tell you everything you need to know about the property, so you are required to complete your own due diligence before bidding. A sample copy of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are also contained within this pack. The buyer will also make payment of £300 including VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack, where it has been provided by iamsold.
The property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price with both the Reserve Price and Starting Bid being subject to change.
